definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
collision/crash/to crash together/to collide with/to bump into
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to crash (into another car)/(fig.) (of opinions, schedules etc) to clash/(of subject matter) to be the same
to knock down and kill sb with a car/to run over sb/to run sb down
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently

sentences.english: A truck rear-end our van on the freeway.
sentences.chinese: 在告訴公路上一輛卡車從後面撞上我們的休旅車。

sentences.english: Officials say new information led to the remains at what is believed to be the crash site.
sentences.chinese: 官方人員稱新信息領導着剩餘的被認爲在撞碎的地方。

sentences.english: He was in such a hurry to get out that he barged into a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 他急急忙忙地往外走，竟與一位行人撞了個滿懷。

sentences.english: On my first time I accidentally crashed into a snow boarder.
sentences.chinese: 第一次滑下來的時候我不小心撞上玩雪地滑板的人。
警官，我的車後部被撞了。

sentences.english: The goat is butting the tree.
A bird thumped against the window.
sentences.chinese: 一隻鳥兒咚的一聲撞在窗上。

sentences.english: One car went too fast and narrowly missed hitting another car.
sentences.chinese: 一輛汽車開得太快，險些兒撞上另一輛汽車。

sentences.english: Some rocks from volcanoes break down to form black sand.
sentences.chinese: 有些火山岩被撞碎後會形成黑色的沙。

sentences.english: While crossing the street, he looked right and left, afraid that he might run into some passing car.
sentences.chinese: 他穿過馬路時，左顧右盼，害怕撞到過路的車子上。

sentences.english: That was a close call.We nearly hit that car.
sentences.chinese: 真是好險啊，我們差點撞上那輛汽車。

sentences.english: An underrun protection device installed at the bottom rear-end of truck is presented.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了一種裝於貨車後下部的防鑽撞保護裝置。

sentences.english: She was so sleepy that she ran into a lamppost.
sentences.chinese: 她太困了以至於撞到了路燈杆上。

sentences.english: A molecule striking an advancing piston recoils with increased speed.
sentences.chinese: 撞在前進中的活塞上的分子，會加速反跳。

sentences.english: They want to know whether they bump into unhealthy environmental influences that cause disease, pressing a directive to seek old a blind person then.
sentences.chinese: 她們想知道自己是否撞邪，於是按着指示去找陳瞎子。

sentences.english: At about that time the debris began to hit the ground.
sentences.chinese: 差不多在那時，航天飛機殘骸開始陸續撞到地面。

definition: to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to knock down and kill sb with a car/to run over sb/to run sb down
collision/crash/to crash together/to collide with/to bump into
to crash (into another car)/(fig.) (of opinions, schedules etc) to clash/(of subject matter) to be the same
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
